metadata.title: CVE-2023-51780 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 6.6.8. do_vcc_ioctl innet/atm/ioctl.c has a use-after-free because of a vcc_recvmsg racecondition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51780` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-251.285
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-251.285
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-251.285
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1129.139
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1166.181
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-251.285').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
